tweet:
just enabled image-to-video for grok-video. pass an `image` param, get motion back.

also wired up alibaba dashscope fallbacks for wan video. if one provider hangs, the other delivers.

making the video stack bulletproof. üêù
alt_tweet:
shipping updates to the video stack:

- grok-video now supports image-to-video (animate anything)
- added alibaba fallbacks for wan video (reliability++)

less downtime, more motion. code is live.
full_tweet:
just enabled image-to-video for grok-video. pass an `image` param, get motion back.

also wired up alibaba dashscope fallbacks for wan video. if one provider hangs, the other delivers.

making the video stack bulletproof. üêù #OpenSource #AI

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene showing a retro CRT monitor. On screen: a static pixel flower on the left transforming into a fluid, animated stream of petals on the right. The Pollinations bee is typing furiously at the keyboard. Soft lime green (#ecf874) screen glow, pastel mint and lavender room gradient. Warm lighting, nostalgic tech vibes, 'Stardew Valley' aesthetic.

reasoning: Focuses on the most tangible user-facing feature (Grok I2V) while highlighting the engineering work behind reliability (fallbacks). The tone is confident, technical, and brief.
